content.text:
Done! I've removed:

1. **The top bar header** (lines 18-48) - The docs will now use the navbar from Layout.astro
2. **The "On This Page" right sidebar** (lines 165-174) - The entire right aside section including the table of contents

The layout now just has the left sidebar navigation and the main content area, using the navbar that's already implemented in Layout.astro.

<script setup lang="ts">
import { Icon } from '@iconify/vue';

<script setup lang="ts">

  sectionId: string;
  text?: string;
}>();

  console.log('LearnMoreButton clicked, sectionId:', props.sectionId);
  openDocsModal(props.sectionId);
  console.log('openDocsModal called');
};
</script>

content.text: I need to pass the docs and categories to the DocsModal. Let me check the docs page to see how they fetch this data:

content.content:
1→---
     2→import DocsLayout from '@layouts/DocsLayout.astro';
     3→import DocsPageView from '@vue/views/docs/DocsPageView.vue';
     4→import { getCollection } from 'astro:content';
     5→import { docCategories } from '@/content/docs/categories';
     6→
     7→// Fetch all docs
     8→const allDocs = await getCollection('docs');
     9→---
    10→
    11→<DocsLayout
    12→  title="Documentation"
    13→  description="Learn how to use Socialaize to manage your social media effectively"
    14→>
    15→  <DocsPageView client:load docs={allDocs} categories={docCategories} />
    16→</DocsLayout>
    17→
